name: [Notice] Delayed Responses from our Support Team due to the Holiday Season
title: [Notice] Delayed Responses from our Support Team due to the Holiday Season
body: Unfortunately, you may experience a delayed response from our team due to limited support during the holiday season! Rest assured that we're doing our best to respond to each and every person.

name: Discord x Influencers Club
title: Discord x Influencers Club
body:
Discord has partnered with Influencers Club to conduct outreach to creators who are not currently on Discord to discuss partnership opportunities. This could include creating a server for their existing fans, monetizing their community using our Server Subscriptions product, or other initiatives.

Influencers Club will send emails to creators on our behalf using an @influencers.club email address. If you receive an email and don’t want to be contacted by Influencers Club again, please reply to their email and ask them to remove you from future outreach.

You can learn more about how Discord is working with creators here: https://discord.com/serversubscriptions

name: Media Channels for Server Subscriptions [BETA]
title: Media Channels for Server Subscriptions [BETA]
body:
Note: This feature is BETA and not available for all servers.

What does this article cover?

  • What are Media Channels?
  • How Do I Create a Media Channel?
    • Upload Media or Files to Your Media Channel
  • What Can I Do with Media Channels?
    • Bonus Content or File Downloads
    • Share Media Channel Posts
  • FAQ

What Are Media Channels?

Media Channels give you a new space to share videos, photos, and files with your community. Similar to Forum Channels, Media Channels are contained in posts, so you can categorize your videos, photos, or files in an easily digestible format for your community to engage with.

How Do I Create a Media Channel?

1. In the channel list, hover over the channel category where you want your Media Channel to live and hit the "+" icon to Create a Channel.

2. Select Media as the channel type, and enter a channel name.

3. Then click Create Channel when you're done!

Upload Media or Files to Your Media Channel

Today, Media channel file uploads must adhere to existing Discord file limitations and compatibility. This varies based if you’re a Nitro subscriber or not.

**Please Note: the thumbnail preview is limited to one media item.

File upload limits:

Everyone — 25MB Uploads
Nitro Basic — 50MB Uploads
Nitro — 500MB Uploads

We recommend testing out different solutions that meet your needs. Our goal is to improve media file compatibility down the road with your feedback and input.

What Can I Do With Media Channels?

There are tons of ways to use Media channels to add more value for your community but here are a few ideas to get you started:

  • Early Access / Behind the Scenes / Bonus Content: You can create a Server Subscription tier which gives paying subscribers access to a Media channel.
  • Wallpapers, PDFs, or other file downloads: Allow subscribers to view and download items from the media channel.
  • Share Media Posts Across Your Server: Let your community know you have a new post to view or file to download! Subscribers will be able to view or download content but subscribers wont have access unless they subscribe.

Bonus Content or File Downloads

To enhance your Server Subscriptions offering you can you can use Media Channels to post content or files for your paying subscribers. This could be for a dedicated Server Subscriptions tier or a way to add additional value to an existing tier. To do this just:

  1. Create a Media Channel and assign a new role connected to a Server Subscription tier. The subscriber will only have access to the new Media channel if they are subscribed.
  2. Start posting content! This could be short behind-the-scenes videos, images, unlisted YouTube videos or even wallpapers, files, and / or PDFs.

BONUS: Don’t forget to share Media channel posts across your server to drive awareness and convert more people into paying subscribers.

Share Media Channel Posts

Media Channels give you a space to provide extra content and or files to subscribers, but in order to get more members of your community to convert into new subscribers you can share individual posts from your Media Channel to other public channels within your server. Non-subscribers will see the post but will not be able to view the content unless they subscribe.

This is what a Media Channel post will look like to non-subscribers when shared to a public channel:

Subscribers will see the media thumbnail revealed when shared to a public channel.

FAQ

Q: What types of content is supported?

A: Videos, photos, and files can be posted to Media channels. File upload size is limited to the existing channels can support today.

Keep in mind, different video links and embeds behave differently depending on the website they are hosted at. Some video links (ie. YouTube) will embed natively and provide a more native viewing experience than others.

Q: This product is in Beta. What happens to my media channel if Discord decides to remove the product?

A: If we decide not to support this feature long-term your media channel will not go away.

Q: Why don’t I see the media channels as an option for my server?

A. Media channels is currently in beta testing and only available to a limited number of servers with Server Subscriptions enabled. We hope to roll this out more broadly in the coming months but cannot share any further details at this time.

Q: What’s the difference between Media Channels and Forum Channels with gallery view?

A: Today, Media channels leverage many of the same foundational elements as Forum Channels in gallery view but with feedback from creators and community admins like you we hope to add unique features over time which make Media channels offer unique solutions for media first communities.

Q: How can I be sure my exclusive content won’t be leaked by my subscribers?

A: Subscribers will be able to see your gated content and non-subscribers will see a blurred image if the post is shared with them.

Over time our tools will improve but if you have feedback, suggestions, on how we can make this better for your community feel free to share it with us!

name: Ownership Transfer of Server with Server Subscriptions
title: Ownership Transfer of Server with Server Subscriptions
body:
Note:
- This guide is only intended to cover the transfer of payout account credentials and server subscription management permissions. It is not intended to cover the sale, license, or transfer of individual user accounts.
- For more information on user account transfers, please see our Terms of Service.

What does this article cover?

  • Who is the Owner? 
  • Existing Owner - Steps to Initiate a Server Transfer
  • New Owner - Requirements For Accepting a Server Transfer
  • New Owner - Steps to Receive a Server Transfer
  • Frequently Asked Questions

Who is the Owner? 

The “owner” of a Discord server is the person who will receive all Server Subscription payouts from a particular server. If you are a server owner considering transferring your server with active Server Subscriptions to another owner. 

Please keep in mind that following an ownership transfer, all payouts will go to the new owner.

If you need to transfer the ownership of a server with Server Subscriptions activated, you can follow the steps below.

EXISTING OWNER - STEPS TO INITIATE A SERVER TRANSFER

Step 1:

Ensure the person you are transferring the server to meets the eligibility requirements from our Server Subscriptions policy AND has set up Team and payment info.

Step 2:

Initiate a Server Transfer (click to see instructions)

🚨 Note:
- Server Subscriptions are currently only available for US based creators - which means you can only transfer to someone else who is based in the US.
- For the full list of eligibility requirements please review the Server Subscriptions policy.
- The Team and payout information must be accepted and validated by our payout provider before the transfer can be completed. For instructions on how to set up Team, please review the Server Subs: Payout Onboarding Guide. 

✅ Note for Partner and Verified Servers:
- Partner and Verified servers must file a support ticket to transfer server ownership. This adds an additional layer of safety for server owners.

NEW OWNER - Requirements For Accepting a Server Transfer

🚨 IMPORTANT 🚨 :
- Before you accept the transfer of a server with Server Subscriptions enabled, you must meet these requirements below:

Step 1: Be eligible to receive a Discord server with Server Subscriptions:

  • Please read our Server Subscriptions policy to ensure your account is eligible.

Step 2: Ensure Delivery of Server Subscriptions Benefits & Perks:

  • Once a server is transferred to you and a new Team with payout information is added, you are responsible for delivery of all benefits and perks associated with existing Server Subscriptions.

NEW OWNER - STEPS TO RECEIVE A SERVER TRANSFER

Once you have confirmed that you met the requirements, follow the steps below in order to accept a server transfer with Server Subscriptions enabled.

Step 1: Set Up Your Team & Payout Information 

Before you can accept a server transfer with active Server Subscriptions you must set up a Discord Team and payout account, so you can get paid!

Please follow these steps to set up a Team and set up your payout account. If you’ve already set up a Team and payout account, you can move to the next step.

Step 2: Accept Monetization Terms & Server Subscription Policy and Select Your Team 

After the old server owner has initiated a server transfer you will need to navigate to Server Subscriptions settings to accept Monetization Terms and Server Subscriptions Policy and update Team info (if needed). The Server Subscription settings will be not be editable until you accept the terms and submit all requested information to set up your payout account.

Step 3: That’s It, You Did It! 

Now you are officially the new Server owner which means you will be responsible for ensuring the existing Server Subscriptions benefits and perks are available for subscribers.

Frequently Asked Questions

Q: Why did my server ownership transfer fail? 

A: This can happen for a number of different reasons, but most likely if you were unable to receive a server (or you were unable to transfer a server to someone else) - then the account receiving the server might not be eligible for Server Subscriptions. 

Please ensure the account that the server is being transferred to meets our Server Subscriptions eligibility requirements AND has set up Team and payment info.

Q: What happens to earnings if my server ownership transfer fails? 

A: If a server transfer fails, the ownership and payout info reverts back to the original owner. Eligible payouts will continue to go to the original owner.

Q: I was transferred a server with Server Subscriptions but I cannot fulfill the benefits and perks that were sold by the previous owner, what should I do? 

A: As the new owner of the server, it is your responsibility to fulfill all perks or benefits associated with the active Server Subscriptions. You must communicate with subscribers about changes to perks and benefits. 

If you materially change what you are offering subscribers, or you’re unable to provide all perks and benefits for active subscribers, you must offer a refund to subscribers.

Q: I had a few active Server Subscriptions but have not reached the $100 threshold for payment, when will I be paid out? 

A: If you have earned money, but have not reached the $100 threshold for payout before transferring ownership, then the money earned to date will be paid out to you once the new owner reaches $100 of revenue earned since the ownership transfer and is approved for payout in accordance with our regular payout schedule. 

If the new owner does not satisfy all eligibility requirements for payout, you will not be eligible for a payout.

Q: What happens if I transfer the server to someone who then violates the Server Subscription Policy? 

A: If the new server owner violates any applicable terms or policies, including the Server Subscriptions Policy, we may apply any remedies referenced in our terms or policies. 

For Server Subscriptions, this can include issuing refunds to all active subscribers, payout ineligibility, or any other remedies referenced in the applicable terms. 

It is the responsibility of the previous and new server owners to resolve any issues with respect to transferred servers and accrued payouts and to ensure that owners operate in compliance with applicable terms and policies.

For more info, please review our Server Subscription policy and Monetization Terms.

Q: How do I set up a Team and Payout information for Server Subscriptions?

A: Please follow these steps to set up a Team and complete your payout information.

Q. I received the error “Application requires a team with an active payout status” when I tried to publish my tiers.

A: Please follow these steps to set up a Team and complete your payout information. 

If you do not do this before accepting the server you will not be able to accept the server transfer and manage the Server Subscriptions.

name: Creator Terms and Policies
title: Creator Terms and Policies
body:
Want to learn more information on relevant Creator terms and policies? Check out these articles from our main support Help Center below!

  • Monetization Terms
  • Discord Server Subscription Policy
  • Discord's Refund Policy

name: Creator Revenue FAQ
title: Creator Revenue FAQ
body:
What this article covers:

  • General FAQ for Monetizing Servers
    • Why can't my server enable Server Subscriptions? 
    • How much money will I get for each Server Subscription? 
    • When will Server Subscriptions be available in more countries?

General FAQ for Monetizing Servers

WHY CAN’T MY SERVER ENABLE SERVER SUBSCRIPTIONS?

To be eligible for Server Subscriptions your account must meet the requirements below. We look at a number of safety and security signals for each account. This is not an exhaustive list, but examples that we offer for transparency and ease of understanding. 

  1. You must be 18 years or older.
  2. Your account must be in good standing. Good standing includes but is not limited to:
    1. You are not actively violating any of Discord’s Terms or Guidelines.
    2. Your account has not received a safety violation in the past 30 days
    3. Your account has not been flagged for suspicious activity usually reserved for safety, abuse, and fraud cases.
    4. No outstanding dues or unpaid charges owed to Discord
  3. You must have both your email and phone number verified
  4. You must have Two Factor Authentication enabled

Please visit the Monetization Terms & Server Subscription Policy for more info.

HOW MUCH MONEY WILL I GET FROM EACH SERVER  SUBSCRIPTION ?

Discord has a 90 / 10 split, meaning you will receive 90% of the money from each membership and Discord will keep 10%. Keep in mind, there are various fees that will impact your final payment amount. 

For more info on Server Subscriptions click here. 

WHEN WILL SERVER SUBSCRIPTIONS BE AVAILABLE IN MORE COUNTRIES?

We are working to make Server Subscriptions available to more creators in more countries but we are not able to share any dates at this time.

name: Server Shop For Server Owners and Admins
title: Server Shop For Server Owners and Admins
body:
Note: Server monetization tools are currently only available for US-based servers. To stay in the loop on international expansion, click here to join the waitlist.

Server Monetization is a way for servers to earn money on Discord. Read on to learn what you need to know as a server admin. If you’re not a server admin but have questions related to Server Subscriptions or Server Products you can visit this help page for more information.

What this article covers:

  • Introduction to monetizing your server
    • How can I monetize my server?
    • Who is eligible to monetize their servers?
    • What types of content am I NOT allowed to monetize on Discord? 
    • How do I get started?
    • How do payments work?
  • Server Subscriptions 
    • What are Server Subscriptions?
    • How do I create Server Subscriptions?
    • How do I disable Server Subscriptions? 
    • How can a subscriber request a refund of a Server Subscription?
  • Server Subscriptions Free Trials  
    • How do I enable Free Trials? 
    • How do I set the duration of the Free Trial? 
    • Can I gift a free month of my Server Subscription to someone? 
    • Can I limit the quantity of Free Trials? 
    • Once a Free Trial period is over will they be immediately charged? 
  • Premium Emoji for Server Subscriptions
    • What are Premium Emoji?
  • Server Products
    • What are Server Products?
    • Who can create Server Products?
    • How do I create a Server Product?
    • How do I delete a Server Product?
    • How can a customer request a refund of a Server Product?
  • Other Frequently Asked Questions
    • Roles, Permissions, & Admins 
    • Mobile Support

Introduction to monetizing your server

How can I monetize my server?

Servers can earn money on Discord by offering Server Subscriptions (a tiered monthly subscription that provides access to exclusive content) and Server Products (currently in beta testing and available to a select group of servers).

Who is eligible to monetize their servers? 

  1. You must be a server owner
  2. Your account must meet the requirements below. Please note that we look at a number of safety and security signals for each account. This is not an exhaustive list, but examples that we offer for transparency and ease of understanding. 
  1. You must be 18 years or older.
  2. Your account must be in good standing. Good standing includes but is not limited to:
    1. You are not actively violating any of Discord’s Terms or Guidelines.
    2. Your account has not received a safety violation in the past 30 days
    3. Your account has not been flagged for suspicious activity usually reserved for safety, abuse, and fraud cases.
    4. No outstanding dues or unpaid charges owed to Discord
  3. You must have your email verified.
  4. You must have Two-Factor Authentication enabled. Please note, you cannot remove 2FA when you have published server subscription tiers in your servers.

Please read the Monetization Terms for more details on the specific eligibility requirements.

What types of content am I NOT allowed to monetize on Discord?

Please closely review the full list of prohibited content in our Monetization Policy. This list includes:

  • Intellectual property
  • Sexually explicit content
  • Online dating
  • Political activity
  • Charity
  • Marketing and advertising third parties
  • And more here

How do I get started?

If you’re a server owner, you must accept the Monetization Terms by heading to Server Settings > Enable Monetization. If you’re not a server owner, please speak with the server owner about taking the steps above.

How do payments work?

How much money will I earn?

Discord has a 90 / 10 split. This means you will receive 90% of the money that you earn from each monthly subscription and/or one-time purchase you sell, and Discord will keep 10%. Keep in mind, there are various fees that will impact your final payment amount.

When will I get paid?

Once you accept our Monetization Terms, your server will be reviewed at the end of each month to determine if you’re eligible to receive a payout. To receive your first payout, your server must have earned at least $100 and meet our Monetization Terms and Monetization Policy. If your server has earned less than $100 on its first monthly review date, it will be reviewed again at the end of the next month—and we’ll continue this process until you’ve earned $100.

Once you’ve earned your first payout, you’ll need to earn $25 to be eligible for subsequent payouts.

For example:

  • If you start monetizing your server on January 1 and earn $100 by January 30, your server would be reviewed on January 31, and you’d most likely receive your $100 payout in February. If you went on to earn at least $25 by February 28, you’d most likely receive that payout in March.
  • If you start monetizing your server on January 15 but don’t earn $100 until February 5, your server would be reviewed on February 28, and you’d most likely receive your $100 payout (plus any additional earnings from February) in March.

How will I receive payments?

To be eligible to receive payouts, you’ll need to create an account with a third-party payout provider made available to you on Discord.

Once you’ve accepted our Monetization Terms, you’ll be prompted to create an account, and you won’t be eligible to receive a payout until our provider has provisioned your account.

Note: Please see our Monetization Terms for more information on payout eligibility, timelines, and process.

SERVER SUBSCRIPTIONS

WHAT ARE SERVER SUBSCRIPTIONS?

Server Subscriptions give you the ability to create subscription tiers for paying members, offering them premium experiences with unlockable servers and channels.

If you’re not a server admin but have questions related to your subscription to a server, you can visit this help page for more information.

HOW DO I CREATE SERVER SUBSCRIPTIONS?

1. Once the server owner has enabled monetization [link to the How do I get started? section above], navigate to the Server Subscriptions tab in your Server Settings.

2. Under Basic Info, select whether you want to make some channels exclusive (our most popular, flexible option) or make your entire server exclusive, which means that every user will need to pay to access it.

3. Under Tiers, choose to create between 1-3 paid tiers. Need help deciding? Click here to review your options and decide what’s best for you.

4. Under Emoji, you can upload Premium Emoji if it’s a perk you’d like to offer your subscribers. This is completely optional—click here to learn more about this option.

HOW DO I DISABLE SERVER SUBSCRIPTIONS? 

In order to fully remove Server Subscriptions from your server, the following must be true:

  • You do not have any active subscribers. If you have active subscribers you’ll need to wait until all active subscriptions are fulfilled and run out.
  • All existing tiers are deleted. Delete all draft and/or archived tiers as well!
  • You do not have a pending payout. If you’re waiting for a payout from Discord, you will need to wait until the payout clears in the next payout cycle before Server Subscriptions can be fully removed from your server—we want to make sure you get paid!

Once you confirm the above statements are true, you can follow the below steps to fully remove Server Subscriptions from your server:

1. Right-click on your server and select Server Subscriptions from the menu

2. Head to the Payment section where you’ll see a Disable Server Subscriptions button in red.

3. Next, for added security, you will be prompted to provide your 2FA code.

4. Once 2FA is verified, your screen will refresh to Start Earning, indicating that Server Subscriptions are no longer active on that server.

HOW CAN A SUBSCRIBER REQUEST A REFUND OF A SERVER SUBSCRIPTION?

If a subscriber would like a refund on a Server Subscription purchase, they can review our refund policy for details and contact our team at the following link: dis.gd/billing. 

Make sure they select Billing in the first dropdown menu and Server Subscription from the Type of Billing Issue dropdown menu to navigate to the refund request form.

SERVER SUBSCRIPTIONS FREE TRIALS

Free Trials allow you to give access to Server Subscription membership benefits for free during the trial window. This lets your community get a sense of the experience so they can decide if they’d like to continue subscribing!

HOW DO I ENABLE FREE TRIALS? 

Free Trials are enabled on a tier-by-tier basis, so to enable them for an existing tier you must “edit''  the tier and enable the “Free Trials for this tier” toggle. This will only enable free trials for the tier you are editing. 

Remember that you are responsible for ensuring your offering and any promotions are promoted in compliance with applicable laws, including applicable advertising laws. 

HOW DO I SET THE DURATION OF THE FREE TRIAL? 

By default, Free Trials are set to (1) week, but you may also set the duration for (1) day. 

CAN I GIFT A FREE MONTH OF MY SERVER SUBSCRIPTION TO SOMEONE?

This is not possible with Free Trials, but you can manually give one or more people access to the channels associated with a Server Subscription tier through Channel Settings.

Remember that you need to manually remove channel access from them if you change your mind. 

CAN I LIMIT THE QUANTITY OF FREE TRIALS?

Yes! You can limit the number of Free Trials each tier has available at a given time from 10, 25, 50, 100, or unlimited (default). Once the number of Free Trials has been reached, there will no longer be any Free Trials available. 

ONCE THE FREE TRIAL IS OVER, WILL THEY BE IMMEDIATELY CHARGED? 

Yes. They can cancel before a Trial ends. At the end of a Trial, if they have not canceled, they will begin paying for recurring monthly subscriptions, charged to their default payment method on file. They must enter a payment method to start a Free Trial if they do not have a payment on file with Discord. They can cancel paid subscriptions at any point to stop auto-renewals the following month.

PREMIUM EMOJI FOR SERVER SUBSCRIPTIONS

What are Premium Emoji?

Adding exclusive Emoji is a great way to add value to your Server Subscription tiers. You can add up to 25 additional custom emoji that only your Server Subscribers can use. 

Note: Animated emoji can be used by all Server Subscribers even without Nitro. However, only Server Subscribers with Nitro can use premium emoji outside of the subscribed server.  

To get started you can access the Premium Emoji tab in the Server Subscriptions settings.

SERVER PRODUCTS

What are Server Products?

Server Products are digital products that are sold as one-time purchases. These products are customizable and managed within your Server Shop. We don't offer support for physical good fulfillment.

  • Downloadables are digital files that you create and upload to Discord in any of these supported file types: .png, .mov, .pdf, .jpeg, and .gif. We’re not able to support: .zip and .rar. You can upload up to 10 files per product totaling a maximum of 500MB. 

You will be able to sell ebooks, guides, digital art, and so much more—just be sure to follow the rules around the types of content you’re not allowed to monetize here.

  • Premium Roles are roles with special permissions that you can sell to provide exclusive access to a channel or other Discord perk without requiring a monthly subscription. For example, if you wanted to sell tickets to a streaming event, you could create a Premium Role that provides one-time access to a Stage Channel on the day of your event.

Who can create Server Products?

Only the server owner can enable monetization, but any member with an admin role can create and manage Server Products.

How do I create a Server Product?

Server Products can only be created and managed on desktop or browser.

1. Once a server owner has enabled monetization, anyone with an admin role can navigate to the Server Products tab within Server Settings and select Create New Product. 

2. Then, you will be able to fill out the details and price for your product, select whether you want to include a Role and/or a Downloadable, and upload your Downloadable (if applicable). 

3. After you have finished, press Publish to upload it to your list of server products as a
Downloadable or Premium Role. 

 

4. Then, navigate to the desired product and select Publish once more. Once you hit Publish, Server Shop will appear at the top of your channel list and be visible to your members. Pressing Server Shop will allow your server members to view the Downloadable or Premium Role and make a one-time purchase.

How do I customize my Server Shop?

Navigate to the Server Products tab within Server Settings and select Basic Info. From here, you can add a description and cover image.

How do members purchase Server Products?

Members can click Server Shop in your channel list to purchase Server Products directly. You can also copy the product link and paste it into any text channel within your server, allowing members to purchase it through the product embed. Head’s up that the product embed will not show up if you share the product link outside of your server.

How do I delete a Server Product? 

Before you delete a Downloadable or Premium Role from your Server Shop, you will need to unpublish it on desktop or through browser. Server Products can only be managed on a desktop computer.

1. To remove the product, head to Server Products within your Server Settings. 

2. Once in Server Products, select the vertical ellipsis within the desired product. This will trigger a menu where you can select Unpublish Product. 

3. Afterwards, the product will show as In Progress and no longer be visible to members in the Server Shop. 

4. Now that the product is unpublished, select the vertical ellipsis and press Delete Product. You will be asked to reconfirm once more that you would like to delete the product, and that should do it!

Once a product has been deleted, this action cannot be undone and you will not be able to recover the product. 

How can a customer request a refund of a Server Product?

We are unable to provide refunds for server products, so please be sure that your product descriptions are honest and accurate to ensure that your customers are satisfied. If you’d like to learn more about our refund policy, you can do so here. 

OTHER FREQUENTLY ASKED QUESTIONS

ROLES, PERMISSIONS, & ADMINS

Q: Is it possible to hide Server Subscription channels from regular members? For example, if I don't want premium inaccessible channels "clogging" up the overall channel list view for those who are not subscribers?

A: No, you can’t hide inaccessible channels at this time. You can order your channels so that premium channels are lower than the free channels. Another option is to create a channel and add the tier role via channel settings (can view, chat etc.), NOT via Server Subscriptions settings. This is similar to how people have hidden channels on their server today.

Q: When creating a Server Subscriptions gated channel, is there a way to give access to certain roles (like moderators + admins) that haven't paid for the premium channels?

A: Yes, you can just create a premium channel and add normal roles as you want. You can add the "admin" or “moderator” role to your premium channels through channel settings. This will allow your admin(s) and moderator(s) to access the premium channels for moderation etc, without needing to purchase a Server Subscription .

Q: We have legacy members that we want to grant access to Server Subscriptions , can I give my legacy VIPs access to premium channels via permissions, without them having to pay?

A: Yes -- you can grant access to Server  Subscriptions  by adding each individual user into the channels via permissions on the backend.

Q: If a Premium member leaves the server (voluntarily or kicked/banned) and then comes back, would they automatically be given their premium perks/role back?

A: If a premium member leaves for any reason (voluntarily, kicked, banned), their Server Subscription is canceled, meaning they won't auto-renew the next month. If a membership holder leaves voluntarily, and then rejoins, they will retain the membership perks and  roles through the remainder of their paid month.

Q: Can admins manage the subscription tiers and see payment details, or is that only possible by the server owner? 

A: Admins can change subscription tier details, but the server owner is the only person who can change and see payment information like payout account details and the payments tab. 

Q: Can individuals temporarily be removed from a premium channel while still staying subscribed? (ie. disciplinary action for breaking the rules etc without performing a full kick or ban.)

A: Yes, you (or your moderators) can time people out without fully removing their subscription benefits. For instructions on time outs, see here.

You would need to give them a role with permissions that denies them the ability to chat, but this is a manual process for each channel, for a specific user, which you'd then have to manually remove later.

Mobile Support

Q: When will Server Subscriptions be supported on the Discord mobile app? 

A: We are currently rolling out In-App Purchasing (IAP) for iOS mobile devices to servers with Server Subscriptions enabled.  

Q: Do mobile subscriptions have the same revenue split as desktop subscriptions?

A: No. Apple takes an additional 30% of revenue from all subscriptions initiated through the Discord iOS application. Subscribers on iOS mobile devices will see a higher price on iOS checkout to account for the additional iOS fee. 

More information on the fee structures is available in the Monetization Terms: https://support.discord.com/hc/en-us/articles/5330075836311-Monetization-Terms

Q: When will subscriptions be purchasable on Android?

A: We’re working on it! We don’t have any timing to share at this point but we are actively working to bring Server Subscriptions to Android mobile devices.

Q: Why am I unable to see Server Products when using the mobile app? 

A: Server Products is currently a limited experiment that’s only available on desktop and web within the United States. If you are still unable to see this feature while on desktop and web, please be sure to join our waitlist here. 

Q: Do my server members get a grace period for Server Subscription payments?
A: Your members with a Server Subscription through the iOS App Store will have a grace period of 28 days to correct the payment issue if their auto-renewal payment fails. If the payment issue is fixed within that 28 day period, the subscription will continue. However, if a successful payment is not made within the 28 days, the subscription and features associated with it will end.

name: Promo Pages
title: Promo Pages
body:
Note: Promo pages are currently only available for monetizing servers.  This  means in order to create a Promo Page you must have Server Subscription tiers enabled and published. For more information about Server Subscriptions, please visit this link.

What this article covers:

  • Introduction to Promo Pages 
    • What is a Promo Page? 
    • Enable Your Promo Page 
    • Why can’t my server enable a Promo Page?
  • Customizing Your Promo Pages 
    • How do I change the images on my Promo Page? 
    • Hide your Server Subscription count  
    • Add a teaser trailer to your Promo Page. 

Introduction to Promo Pages

WHAT IS A PROMO PAGE?

A Promo page gives you a new way to promote your Discord Server Subscription offering. A Promo Page is a web based page which allows you to more easily promote and share your Discord Server Subscription offering with audiences outside of Discord because they can view and access the page without being logged-in to Discord.   

ENABLE YOUR PROMO PAGE

In order to make your Promo Page “live” you will need to enable Server Subscriptions  toggle “Show Your Premium Offering” to On.

WHY CAN’T MY SERVER ENABLE A PROMO PAGE?

Promo pages are ONLY available if you qualify for Server Subscriptions and have a Server Subscription tier published.

Note: Both Server Subscriptions and Promo Pages are only available for US based servers. 

Customizing Your Promo Page

You can add some basic customizations to your Promo Page. Your Promo page will use the same image assets as your Server Subscriptions page. 

HOW DO I CHANGE THE IMAGES ON MY PROMO PAGE? 

You can change the assets on your Promo Page by uploading new assets to your Server Subscriptions settings page. It's not possible to upload different assets to your Promo page than the assets you are using for your Server Subscriptions.

Note: It could take up to 5 minutes after you upload new images to your Server Subscriptions page for your Promo page to update. 

HIDE YOUR SERVER SUBSCRIPTION COUNT

Server Subscription Count - if you do not want to show the number of Server Subscriptions you have on your Promo page you can turn the toggle “off” to hide it. By default the number of Server Subscriptions you have will be public. 

ADD A TEASER TRAILER TO YOUR PROMO PAGE

Promo pages give you the ability to embed a YouTube video at the top of your page. To do this just paste the link to your YouTube video. The video will need to be public or unlisted.
